lines: So many tragedies have befallen us in recent years. The Calamity, the primals... Alas, it is only within our power to shepherd the souls of the fallen, and pray that they find peace in Thal's realm.
You and Cid shall ever be in my thoughts, Forename. Return whenever you require respite.
Have you perchance come here in search of Cid? If so, I fear I must disappoint you. Though he paid me a visit, it was regrettably brief, for he had more pressing matters to attend to in Mor Dhona.
Hildibrand? Why, yes, there is a gentleman interred here by that name. If you have come to pay your respects, I can─
He has risen!? Thal forgive me, I thought we had rid the lichyard of zombies...
Minfilia has been blessed with a rare opportunity. Most have no choice but to await passage into Thal's realm to reunite with the lost.
My child, the gods be praised for your preservation. To think that such an evil fate would befall the Scions...
Yet know that the wicked shall eventually be cast down. The day will come when the light of truth will shine for all to see, and you and yours are freed from the pall of ignominy.
It brings me joy to see that the Scions' good name has been restored.
Yet it would be naive to think that the wrongs done to you and yours can ever truly be redressed.
We were visited by a refugee just the other day. He said he had come to share the news of his impending move to the Saltery.

It would seem that a companion─one who did not survive their flight across the badlands all those years ago─is buried here in the lichyard... I feel I was afforded a glimpse of the bittersweet joy that many an Ala Mhigan must surely now endure.
